item.title: This is a test

item.title: Website content creation nugget 1
item.description: TL;DR: The objective of this post is to reflect on how we write and to set up a template to reuse in future blog posts. Tips for blog post writing Writing research papers is not the same as writing academic blogs. The former is more prescriptive, limited to a number of characters, and usually constrained to 4-5 figures and tables (sure, we can go crazy in the supplementary material, but there’s a reason why it’s supplementary … ).

item.title: Resources
item.description: This page will be updated continuously to highlight functions, packages, and presentations useful for R users. It will generally contain a brief description and links to tutorials or vignettes. If there’s something I’d love for you to learn more about I will create a separate blog post. Keep an eye out! Learn R Visualization Modeling Rmarkdown Shiny

item.title: Setting up my webpage - you can do it too!
item.description: Aim The purpose of this markdown is to generate my own page and document the process for peers in my research group and others. Scope In this document I will be following Allison Hill’s Up & running with blogdown in 2021 post. The steps here deviate a bit from her proposed 7 step guide, but I used it as a starting point. I will provide my own commentary and experience deploying a website from R for the first time.
